name: Sack Lunch: Mung Bean Noodles with Dulse and Crushed Peanuts
description: For a month or two now I have been searching for an Asian or Asian-y noodle dish that would make a nice lunch. A few candidates didn't pan out, and the one that did was a soup, which I know...
recipeIngredient: 4 scallions, including a little of the greens, thinly sliced diagonally
2 teaspoons roasted peanut oil (I used dark sesame oil)
1 jalapeño chile, seeded and finely diced
Several red dulse "leaves," soaked in water for 5 minutes

recipeInstructions.text: Cover the mung bean noodles with boiling water and let stand until softened, about 5 minutes. Drain and put them in a bowl with the carrots, cucumber, and scallions.
Whisk the vinegar, oil, sugar, and a pinch of salt together, then add the ginger and chile. Pour over the noodles and toss well.
Drain the dulse, coarsely chop, and add it to the noodles with the cilantro and most of the peanuts. Toss again and serve with the remaining peanuts sprinkled over the top.
